trial_identification.studytitle: How effective is misoprostol alone in termination of first trimester viable pregnancy?
trial_identification.scientifictitle: women who received misoprostol to terminate their first trimester pregnancy are followed up till the end of their pregnancy whether by abortion or livebirth.

conditions.healthcondition: Termination of first trimester viable pregnancy

interventions.interventions: Clinical and sonographic follow up every 4 weeks till the end of pregnancy by miscarriage or delivery, in women who have taken misoprostol to deliberately terminate the current pregnancy.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Neonatal outcome as assessed by clinical examination of the newborn by pediatrician evaluation of Apgar score and exclusion or detection of anomalies.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: pregnant women presented in their first trimester after intake of misoprostol to deliberately terminate the current pregnancy.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Intake of other drugs during the same period.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Mervat sheikhelarab Elsedeek Omran. Professor of obstetrics and gynecology, Faculty of medicine, alexandria university.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: women reporting first trimester use of misoprostol were evaluated by ultrasonography to detect the condition of pregnancy. If pregnancy was still present and viable, monthly follow up clinically and by ultrasound was arranged till the end of pregnancy.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Alexandria Faculty of Medicine institutional review board.
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Alexandria Faculty of Medicine, Elazarita, Alexandria, Egypt. 03312
